translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Bao of Wei to become King of Western Wei, giving him control of Hedong, with his capital at Pingyang.

context.previous: 立董翳為翟王，王上郡，都高奴。
context.next: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。

translations.chinese: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。
translations.literal: Xiaqiu Shen Yang was Zhang Er's favored minister, first conquered Henan commandery, welcomed Chu along the Yellow River, therefore established Shen Yang as King of Henan, with capital at Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Yang from Xiaqiu was Zhang Er's favorite minister. He had first conquered Henan commandery and welcomed Chu forces along the Yellow River. Therefore they installed Shen Yang as King of Henan, with his capital at Luoyang.

context.previous: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。
context.next: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。

translations.chinese: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。
translations.literal: King Cheng of Han remained at his original capital, capital Yangdi.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Han kept his original capital at Yangdi.

context.previous: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。
context.next: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。

translations.chinese: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。
translations.literal: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan, repeatedly achieved merit, therefore established Ang as King of Yin, ruling Henan, with capital at Zhaoge.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan and achieved repeated successes. Therefore they installed him as King of Yin, giving him control of Henan, with his capital at Zhaoge.

context.previous: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。
context.next: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.chinese: 徙趙王歇為代王。
translations.literal: Moved King Xie of Zhao to become King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Xie of Zhao to become King of Dai.

context.previous: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。
context.next: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。

translations.chinese: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。
translations.literal: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er was long known for his worthiness, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Er as King of Changshan, ruling Zhao territory, with capital at Xiangguo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er had long been recognized for his worthiness and had followed them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Changshan, giving him control of Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo.

context.previous: 徙趙王歇為代王。
context.next: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。

translations.chinese: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。
translations.literal: Lord Dangyang Ying Bu served as Chu general, constantly led the vanguard, therefore established Bu as King of Jiujiang, with capital at Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Dangyang Ying Bu had served as a Chu general and constantly led the vanguard. Therefore they installed him as King of Jiujiang, with his capital at Liu.

context.previous: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。
context.next: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.chinese: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。
translations.literal: Lord of Po Wu Rui led the hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Rui as King of Hengshan, with capital at Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Lord of Po Wu Rui had led the hundred Yue tribes to assist the feudal lords and had followed them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Hengshan, with his capital at Zhu.

context.previous: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。
context.next: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.chinese: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。
translations.literal: The Righteous Emperor's Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanguo, achieved much merit, therefore established Ao as King of Linjiang, with capital at Jiangling.
translations.idiomatic: The Righteous Emperor's Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanguo and achieved great success. Therefore they installed him as King of Linjiang, with his capital at Jiangling.

context.previous: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。
context.next: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。

translations.chinese: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。
translations.literal: Moved King Guang of Yan to become King of Liaodong.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Guang of Yan to become King of Liaodong.

context.previous: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。
context.next: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.chinese: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。
translations.literal: Yan general Zang Chu followed Chu to rescue Zhao, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Chu as King of Yan, with capital at Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Yan general Zang Chu had followed Chu to rescue Zhao and had accompanied them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Yan, with his capital at Ji.

context.previous: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。
context.next: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.chinese: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。
translations.literal: Moved King Shi of Qi to become King of Jiaodong.
translations.idiomatic: They relocated King Shi of Qi to become King of Jiaodong.

context.previous: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。
context.next: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.chinese: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。
translations.literal: Qi general Tian Du followed together to rescue Zhao, moreover followed into the passes, therefore established Du as King of Qi, with capital at Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi general Tian Du had joined the rescue of Zhao and accompanied them into the passes. Therefore they installed him as King of Qi, with his capital at Linzi.

context.previous: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。
context.next: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。

translations.chinese: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。
translations.literal: Formerly Qin destroyed Qi King Jian's grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu was just crossing the river to rescue Zhao, Tian An conquered several cities north of the Ji River, led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu, therefore established An as King of Jibei, with capital at Boyang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian An, grandson of the Qi King Jian whom Qin had destroyed, conquered several cities north of the Ji River while Xiang Yu was crossing to rescue Zhao. He led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu. Therefore they installed him as King of Jibei, with his capital at Boyang.

context.previous: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。
context.next: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。

translations.chinese: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。
translations.literal: Tian Rong, repeatedly betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover refused to lead troops following Chu to attack Qin, for this reason was not enfeoffed.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong had repeatedly betrayed Xiang Liang and refused to lead troops to follow Chu in attacking Qin. For this reason, he was not enfeoffed.

context.previous: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。
context.next: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。

translations.chinese: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。
translations.literal: Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu abandoned his general's seal and departed, did not follow into the passes, yet long known for his worthiness, had merit in Zhao, heard he was in Nanpi, therefore provisionally enfeoffed three counties around it.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu had abandoned his general's seal and left, refusing to follow into the passes. Yet he was long known for his worthiness and had merit in Zhao. Hearing he was in Nanpi, they provisionally enfeoffed him with three surrounding counties.

context.previous: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。
context.next: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.chinese: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。
translations.literal: Lord of Fan's general Mei Dun achieved much merit, therefore enfeoffed as marquis of one hundred thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Fan's general Mei Dun had achieved great merit. Therefore he was enfeoffed as a marquis with one hundred thousand households.

context.previous: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。
context.next: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.chinese: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。
translations.literal: King Xiang self-established as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling nine commanderies, with capital at Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang established himself as Hegemon King of Western Chu, ruling nine commanderies, with his capital at Pengcheng.

context.previous: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.chinese: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
translations.literal: In the fourth month of the first year of Han, the feudal lords departed from below Xi, each going to their kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of the first year of Han, the feudal lords left the area below Xi and each returned to their kingdoms.

context.next: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.chinese: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
translations.literal: King Xiang sent out from his kingdom, sent people to move the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors had territories of a thousand li, must reside upstream.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang sent orders from his kingdom to relocate the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors ruled territories of a thousand li and always resided upstream.'

context.previous: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。
context.next: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。

translations.chinese: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。
translations.literal: Then sent envoys to move the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent envoys to relocate the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha.

context.previous: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
context.next: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。

translations.chinese: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。
translations.literal: Urged the Righteous Emperor to travel, his ministers gradually deserted him, then secretly ordered the Kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill him in the river.
translations.idiomatic: He urged the Righteous Emperor to proceed on his journey. His ministers gradually deserted him. Xiang Yu then secretly ordered the Kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill him in the river.

context.previous: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。
context.next: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.chinese: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。
translations.literal: King Cheng of Han had no military merit, King Xiang did not send him to his kingdom, brought him together to Pengcheng, demoted him to marquis, then again killed him.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng of Han had no military merit. King Xiang did not allow him to go to his kingdom but brought him to Pengcheng, demoted him to marquis, and then killed him.

context.previous: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。
context.next: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.chinese: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，
translations.literal: Zang Chu went to his kingdom, then pursued Han Guang to Liaodong, Guang did not listen, Chu attacked and killed Guang at Wuzhong,
translations.idiomatic: Zang Chu went to his kingdom and then pursued Han Guang to Liaodong. Han Guang refused to comply, so Zang Chu attacked and killed him at Wuzhong.

context.previous: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.chinese: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
translations.literal: Tian Rong heard Xiang Yu moved Qi King Shi to Jiaodong, and established Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi, then greatly angered, refused to send the Qi king to Jiaodong, therefore with Qi rebelled, met and attacked Tian Du.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong learned that Xiang Yu had moved Qi King Shi to Jiaodong and installed Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi. He flew into a rage, refused to send the Qi king to Jiaodong, and led Qi in rebellion, attacking Tian Du.

context.next: 田都走楚。

translations.chinese: 田都走楚。
translations.literal: Tian Du fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Du escaped to Chu.

context.previous: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。
context.next: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.chinese: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
translations.literal: Qi King Shi feared King Xiang, then fled to Jiaodong to take up his kingdom.
translations.idiomatic: Qi King Shi feared King Xiang and fled to Jiaodong to assume his kingship.

context.previous: 田都走楚。
context.next: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。

translations.chinese: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。
translations.literal: Tian Rong angered, pursued and attacked, killed him at Jimo.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong, enraged, pursued and attacked him, killing Qi King Shi at Jimo.

context.previous: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。
context.next: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。

translations.chinese: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。
translations.literal: Rong therefore self-established as King of Qi, and westward attacked and killed Jibei King Tian An, united and ruled the three Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong therefore proclaimed himself King of Qi. He attacked westward and killed Jibei King Tian An, uniting all three Qi regions under his rule.

context.previous: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。
context.next: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。

translations.chinese: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。
translations.literal: Rong gave Peng Yue the general's seal, ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong gave Peng Yue a general's seal and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.

context.previous: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。
context.next: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。

translations.chinese: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
translations.literal: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Yue to persuade Qi King Tian Rong saying: 'Xiang Yu acts as butcher of the world, not fair.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Yue to persuade Qi King Tian Rong: 'Xiang Yu acts as the world's butcher. His actions are unfair.'

context.previous: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。
context.next: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。

translations.chinese: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
translations.literal: Now completely kings the former kings in bad lands, but kings his ministers and generals in good lands, drives out their former lord King of Zhao, makes him reside north in Dai, Yu considers it not right.
translations.idiomatic: Now he installs all the former kings in barren lands but gives his ministers and generals the fertile territories. He drives out their former lord, King of Zhao, and forces him to live in the north in Dai. I consider this unjust.'

context.previous: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。
context.next: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.chinese: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
translations.literal: Heard Your Majesty raised troops, moreover does not listen to unrighteous matters, wish Your Majesty provide Yu with troops, request to attack Changshan, to restore the King of Zhao, request to use the kingdom as shield.'
translations.idiomatic: I hear Your Majesty has raised troops and refuses to heed injustice. I wish Your Majesty would provide me with troops to attack Changshan, restore the King of Zhao, and use my kingdom as a protective barrier.'

context.previous: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。
context.next: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。

translations.chinese: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。
translations.literal: The Qi king agreed to it, therefore sent troops to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi agreed and sent troops to Zhao.

context.previous: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」
context.next: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。

translations.chinese: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。
translations.literal: Chen Yu mobilized all the troops from the three counties, joined with Qi in attacking Changshan, greatly defeating them.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu mobilized troops from all three counties and joined forces with Qi to attack Changshan, decisively defeating them.

context.previous: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。
context.next: 張耳走歸漢。

translations.chinese: 張耳走歸漢。
translations.literal: Zhang Er fled and returned to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Er fled back to Han.

context.previous: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。
context.next: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.chinese: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。
translations.literal: Chen Yu welcomed the former Zhao King Xie from Dai, returned him to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu welcomed the former King Xie of Zhao from Dai and restored him to Zhao.

context.previous: 張耳走歸漢。
context.next: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.chinese: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。
translations.literal: The Zhao king therefore established Chen Yu as King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Zhao then installed Chen Yu as King of Dai.

context.previous: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.chinese: 是時，漢還定三秦。
translations.literal: At this time, Han returned and pacified the three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Han forces returned and pacified the three Qin regions.

context.next: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。

translations.chinese: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard the Han king had already annexed all of Guanzhong, moreover was coming east, Qi and Zhao had rebelled against him: greatly angered.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu learned that the King of Han had annexed all of Guanzhong and was advancing eastward, while Qi and Zhao had rebelled against him. He flew into a rage.

context.previous: 是時，漢還定三秦。
context.next: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。

translations.chinese: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。
translations.literal: Then made the former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang King of Han, to resist Han.
translations.idiomatic: He then installed Zheng Chang, the former magistrate of Wu, as King of Han to block Han's advance.

context.previous: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。
context.next: 令蕭公角等擊彭越。

translations.chinese: 令蕭公角等擊彭越。
translations.literal: Ordered Xiao Gongjiao and others to attack Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Xiao Gongjiao and others to attack Peng Yue.

context.previous: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。
context.next: 彭越敗蕭公角等。

translations.chinese: 彭越敗蕭公角等。
translations.literal: Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gongjiao and others.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gongjiao and his forces.

context.previous: 令蕭公角等擊彭越。
context.next: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」

translations.chinese: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」
translations.literal: Han sent Zhang Liang to pacify Han, then sent Xiang Yu a letter saying: 'The Han king has lost his position, wishes to obtain Guanzhong, if according to agreement then stops, dares not go east.'
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Zhang Liang to pacify the region of Han, then sent Xiang Yu a letter: 'The King of Han has been deprived of his rightful position. He wishes to regain Guanzhong. If we honor our original agreement, he will stop there and not advance eastward.'

context.previous: 彭越敗蕭公角等。
context.next: 又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」

translations.chinese: 又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」
translations.literal: Moreover sent Qi and Liang's rebellion letter to Xiang Yu saying: 'Qi wishes to join with Zhao to destroy Chu together.'
translations.idiomatic: Han also sent Xiang Yu letters from the rebellions in Qi and Liang: 'Qi intends to join forces with Zhao to destroy Chu.'

context.previous: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」
context.next: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。

translations.chinese: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。
translations.literal: Chu for this reason had no intention to go west, but north attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Because of this, Chu had no intention of advancing west but turned north to attack Qi.

context.previous: 又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」
context.next: 徵兵九江王布。

translations.chinese: 徵兵九江王布。
translations.literal: Conscripted troops from Jiujiang King Bu.
translations.idiomatic: He conscripted troops from Ying Bu, King of Jiujiang.

context.previous: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。
context.next: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。

translations.chinese: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。
translations.literal: Bu pleaded illness and did not go, sent a general leading several thousand to go.
translations.idiomatic: Ying Bu claimed illness and refused to go personally, but sent a general with several thousand troops.

context.previous: 徵兵九江王布。
context.next: 項王由此怨布也。

translations.chinese: 項王由此怨布也。
translations.literal: King Xiang from this resented Bu.
translations.idiomatic: From this point on, King Xiang harbored resentment toward Ying Bu.

context.previous: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。
context.next: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。

translations.chinese: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。
translations.literal: In the winter of the second year of Han, Xiang Yu then went north to Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops to meet in battle.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the second year of Han, Xiang Yu marched north to Chengyang, where Tian Rong also led troops to engage him in battle.

context.previous: 項王由此怨布也。
context.next: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。

translations.chinese: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。
translations.literal: Tian Rong could not prevail, fled to Pingyuan, the Pingyuan people killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong was defeated and fled to Pingyuan, where the local people killed him.

context.previous: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。
context.next: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。

translations.chinese: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。
translations.literal: Then north burned and destroyed Qi's city walls and houses, all buried alive Tian Rong's surrendered soldiers, bound and captured their old and weak women.
translations.idiomatic: He then marched north, burning and destroying Qi's cities and buildings. He massacred all of Tian Rong's surrendered troops and took captive their elderly, weak, and womenfolk.

context.previous: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。
context.next: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。

translations.chinese: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。
translations.literal: Pacified Qi reaching Beihai, did much destruction and extermination.
translations.idiomatic: He pacified the region of Qi all the way to Beihai, causing widespread destruction and slaughter.

context.previous: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。
context.next: 齊人相聚而叛之。

translations.chinese: 齊人相聚而叛之。
translations.literal: The Qi people gathered together and rebelled against him.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi gathered in groups and rebelled against Xiang Yu.

context.previous: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。
context.next: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。

translations.chinese: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。
translations.literal: Thereupon Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi's scattered soldiers getting several ten thousand people, rebelled at Chengyang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng then gathered tens of thousands of Qi's scattered troops and launched a rebellion at Chengyang.

context.previous: 齊人相聚而叛之。
context.next: 項王因留，連戰未能下。

translations.chinese: 項王因留，連戰未能下。
translations.literal: King Xiang therefore stayed, fought continuously but could not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang therefore remained there, fighting continuous battles but unable to take the city.

context.previous: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。

translations.chinese: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。
translations.literal: Spring, the Han king commanded the five feudal lords' troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, east attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In spring, the King of Han commanded the combined armies of five allied lords—totaling 560,000 men—and launched an eastward campaign against Chu.

context.next: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。

translations.chinese: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。
translations.literal: King Xiang heard this, immediately ordered the various generals to attack Qi, and himself with elite troops thirty thousand people south from Lu emerged at Huling.
translations.idiomatic: Upon hearing this, King Xiang immediately ordered his generals to continue attacking Qi while he himself led 30,000 elite troops south from Lu, emerging at Huling.

context.previous: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。
context.next: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。

translations.chinese: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。
translations.literal: Fourth month, Han all had already entered Pengcheng, collected its goods, treasures, and beauties, daily set wine and grand gatherings.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, Han forces had completely occupied Pengcheng. They collected all the riches, treasures, and beautiful women. Every day they held lavish drinking parties and celebrations.

context.previous: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。
context.next: 項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。

translations.chinese: 項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。
translations.literal: King Xiang then west from Xiao, at dawn attacked the Han army and went east, reached Pengcheng, at noon, greatly defeated the Han army.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang marched west from Xiao, attacked the Han army at dawn, and advanced eastward. By noon he had reached Pengcheng and decisively defeated the Han forces.

context.previous: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。
context.next: 漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。

translations.chinese: 漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。
translations.literal: Han army all fled, following each other entered the Gu and Si rivers, killed Han soldiers more than ten ten thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army fled in panic, crowding into the Gu and Si Rivers. Xiang Yu's forces killed over 100,000 Han soldiers.

context.previous: 項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。
context.next: 漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。

translations.chinese: 漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。
translations.literal: Han soldiers all south fled to the mountains, Chu again pursued and attacked to east of Lingbi on the Sui River.
translations.idiomatic: The Han soldiers all fled south into the mountains. The Chu forces pursued them relentlessly, attacking as far east as Lingbi on the Sui River.

context.previous: 漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。
context.next: 漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。

translations.chinese: 漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。
translations.literal: Han army retreated, squeezed by Chu, much killing, Han soldiers more than ten ten thousand people all entered the Sui River, the Sui River because of this did not flow.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army retreated, pressed hard by the Chu forces. In the slaughter that followed, over 100,000 Han soldiers plunged into the Sui River, clogging it so completely that the river stopped flowing.

context.previous: 漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。
context.next: 圍漢王三匝。

translations.chinese: 圍漢王三匝。
translations.literal: Surrounded the Han king three circuits.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu forces encircled the King of Han three times.

context.previous: 漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。
context.next: 於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。

translations.chinese: 於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。
translations.literal: Thereupon great wind from northwest arose, broke trees and lifted roofs, raised sand and stones, dark and gloomy daylight turned to darkness, met the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Suddenly a great wind arose from the northwest, snapping trees and tearing off roofs, whipping up sand and stones. Day turned to dark gloom, and the wind struck the Chu army head-on.

context.previous: 圍漢王三匝。
context.next: 楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；

translations.chinese: 楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；
translations.literal: Chu army greatly disordered, broken and scattered, and the Han king then was able with several ten horsemen to escape, wished to pass through Pei, collect family and go west;
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army fell into great confusion and scattered in disarray. The King of Han escaped with only a few dozen horsemen. He wanted to pass through Pei, gather his family, and flee westward.

context.previous: 於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。
context.next: 楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。

translations.chinese: 楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。
translations.literal: Chu also sent people to pursue to Pei, seize the Han king's family: the family all fled, did not meet with the Han king.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu forces also sent men to pursue him to Pei and seize his family. But his family had all fled and did not meet with the King of Han.

context.previous: 楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；
context.next: 漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。

translations.chinese: 漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。
translations.literal: Han king on the road encountered and obtained Xiaohui, Lu Yuan, then loaded and traveled.
translations.idiomatic: Along the way, the King of Han encountered and rescued his son Xiaohui and daughter Lu Yuan, then took them with him as he fled.

context.previous: 楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。
context.next: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。

translations.chinese: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。
translations.literal: Chu cavalry pursued the Han king, Han king urgent, pushed and dropped Xiaohui, Lu Yuan under the cart, Teng Gong often descended and collected and loaded them.
translations.idiomatic: Chu cavalry pursued the King of Han relentlessly. In desperation, he pushed his son Xiaohui and daughter Lu Yuan off the cart. Teng Gong repeatedly dismounted to pick them up and put them back on.

context.previous: 漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。
context.next: 如是者三。

translations.chinese: 如是者三。
translations.literal: Like this three times.
translations.idiomatic: This happened three times.

context.previous: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。
context.next: 曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」

translations.chinese: 曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」
translations.literal: Said: 'Though urgent cannot drive fast, how can abandon them?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Even in desperate flight, we cannot abandon them. How could we leave them behind?'

context.previous: 如是者三。
context.next: 於是遂得脫。

translations.chinese: 於是遂得脫。
translations.literal: Thereupon then was able to escape.
translations.idiomatic: Thus they managed to escape.

context.previous: 曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」
context.next: 求太公、呂后不相遇。

translations.chinese: 求太公、呂后不相遇。
translations.literal: Sought Taigong, Empress Lu, did not meet.
translations.idiomatic: He searched for his father Taigong and Empress Lu but could not find them.

context.previous: 於是遂得脫。
context.next: 審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。

translations.chinese: 審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。
translations.literal: Shen Yiji followed Taigong, Empress Lu in secret travel, sought the Han king, instead encountered Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Yiji was traveling secretly with Taigong and Empress Lu, searching for the King of Han. Instead, they encountered Chu troops.

context.previous: 求太公、呂后不相遇。
context.next: 楚軍遂與歸，報項王，項王常置軍中。

translations.chinese: 楚軍遂與歸，報項王，項王常置軍中。
translations.literal: Chu army then gave them back, reported to King Xiang, King Xiang constantly placed them in the army.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army then returned them safely and reported to King Xiang, who kept them in his military camp.

context.previous: 審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。

translations.chinese: 是時呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵居下邑，漢王閒往從之，稍稍收其士卒。
translations.literal: At this time Empress Lu's elder brother Marquis Zhou Lu commanded Han troops stationed at Xiayi, Han king secretly went to join him, gradually gathered his soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Empress Lu's brother Marquis Zhou Lu commanded Han troops stationed at Xiayi. The King of Han secretly went to join him and gradually rallied the scattered soldiers.

context.next: 至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。

translations.chinese: 至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。
translations.literal: Reached Xingyang, the various defeated armies all assembled, Xiao He also mobilized Guanzhong elderly and weak not yet registered all went to Xingyang, again greatly flourished.
translations.idiomatic: He reached Xingyang where all the defeated armies assembled. Xiao He also mobilized the elderly and weak from Guanzhong who had not yet been registered for service, sending them all to Xingyang. Han's strength was greatly restored.

context.previous: 是時呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵居下邑，漢王閒往從之，稍稍收其士卒。
context.next: 楚起於彭城，常乘勝逐北，與漢戰滎陽南京、索閒，漢敗楚，楚以故不能過滎陽而西。

translations.chinese: 楚起於彭城，常乘勝逐北，與漢戰滎陽南京、索閒，漢敗楚，楚以故不能過滎陽而西。
translations.literal: Chu arose from Pengcheng, constantly took advantage of victory to pursue the fleeing, fought with Han at Xingyang south of the capital, Suo between, Han defeated Chu, Chu therefore could not pass Xingyang and go west.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's campaign began at Pengcheng, and they constantly pursued fleeing enemies on the momentum of victory. They fought Han forces south of the capital at Xingyang and in the region of Suo. Han defeated Chu there, so Chu could not advance past Xingyang to the west.

context.previous: 至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。

translations.chinese: 項王之救彭城，追漢王至滎陽，田橫亦得收齊，立田榮子廣為齊王。
translations.literal: King Xiang's rescue of Pengcheng, pursued Han king to Xingyang, Tian Heng also was able to gather Qi, established Tian Rong's son Guang as King of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: While King Xiang was rescuing Pengcheng and pursuing the Han king to Xingyang, Tian Heng was able to rally Qi and install Tian Rong's son Guang as King of Qi.

context.next: 漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。

translations.chinese: 漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。
translations.literal: Han king's defeat at Pengcheng, the feudal lords all again joined with Chu and turned against Han.
translations.idiomatic: After the Han king's defeat at Pengcheng, all the feudal lords switched back to Chu's side and abandoned Han.

context.previous: 項王之救彭城，追漢王至滎陽，田橫亦得收齊，立田榮子廣為齊王。
context.next: 漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。

translations.chinese: 漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。
translations.literal: Han army at Xingyang, built a covered walkway connecting to the river, to take Aocang grain.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army at Xingyang built a covered walkway connecting to the Yellow River to transport grain from the Aocang granary.

context.previous: 漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。
context.next: 漢之三年，項王數侵奪漢甬道，漢王食乏，恐，請和，割滎陽以西為漢。

translations.chinese: 漢之三年，項王數侵奪漢甬道，漢王食乏，恐，請和，割滎陽以西為漢。
translations.literal: Han third year, King Xiang repeatedly invaded and seized Han's covered walkway, Han king provisions lacking, feared, requested peace, ceded Xingyang west to Han.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Han, King Xiang repeatedly attacked and seized Han's covered walkway. The Han king ran short of supplies and, fearing defeat, sued for peace, ceding all territory west of Xingyang to Han.

context.previous: 漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。

translations.chinese: 項王欲聽之。
translations.literal: King Xiang wished to listen to it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang was inclined to accept the peace terms.

context.next: 歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」

translations.chinese: 歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」
translations.literal: Marquis of Liyang Fan Zeng said: 'Han is easy to deal with, now release without taking, later must regret it.'
translations.idiomatic: Marquis of Liyang Fan Zeng said: 'Han is easy to defeat. If we let them go now without destroying them, we'll surely regret it later.'

context.previous: 項王欲聽之。
context.next: 項王乃與范增急圍滎陽。

translations.chinese: 項王乃與范增急圍滎陽。
translations.literal: King Xiang then with Fan Zeng urgently besieged Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then joined Fan Zeng in urgently besieging Xingyang.

context.previous: 歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」
context.next: 漢王患之，乃用陳平計閒項王。

translations.chinese: 漢王患之，乃用陳平計閒項王。
translations.literal: Han king worried about it, then used Chen Ping's plan to sow discord in King Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was troubled by this and adopted Chen Ping's plan to sow dissension between Xiang Yu and his advisors.

context.previous: 項王乃與范增急圍滎陽。
context.next: 項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。

translations.chinese: 項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。
translations.literal: King Xiang's envoy came, prepared a grand feast, raised it wishing to present it.
translations.idiomatic: An envoy from King Xiang arrived. They prepared a grand feast and raised their cups, intending to present it.

context.previous: 漢王患之，乃用陳平計閒項王。
context.next: 見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」

translations.chinese: 見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」
translations.literal: Saw the envoy, pretended to be shocked and astonished, said: 'I thought it was the Secondary Father's envoy, but instead it is King Xiang's envoy.'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the envoy, he pretended to be shocked: 'I thought this was an envoy from the Secondary Father, but it's actually King Xiang's envoy.'

context.previous: 項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。
context.next: 更持去，以惡食食項王使者。

translations.chinese: 更持去，以惡食食項王使者。
translations.literal: Changed and took away, fed King Xiang's envoy with inferior food.
translations.idiomatic: They switched it out and served King Xiang's envoy inferior food instead.

context.previous: 見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」
context.next: 使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。

translations.chinese: 使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。
translations.literal: The envoy returned and reported to King Xiang, King Xiang then suspected Fan Zeng had private dealings with Han, gradually stripped him of authority.
translations.idiomatic: The envoy returned and reported to King Xiang. King Xiang then suspected that Fan Zeng was secretly collaborating with Han and gradually stripped him of his authority.

context.previous: 更持去，以惡食食項王使者。
context.next: 范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。

translations.chinese: 范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。
translations.literal: Fan Zeng greatly angered, said: 'The world's affairs are largely settled, Your Majesty do it yourself.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng flew into a rage: 'The empire's affairs are largely settled now. Your Majesty can handle them yourself.'

context.previous: 使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。
context.next: 願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」

translations.chinese: 願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」
translations.literal: Wish to grant my old bones to return to the ranks.'
translations.idiomatic: Please allow this old man to retire to the ranks of common soldiers.'

context.previous: 范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。
context.next: 項王許之。

translations.chinese: 項王許之。
translations.literal: King Xiang permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang granted his request.

context.previous: 願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」
context.next: 行未至彭城，疽發背而死。

translations.chinese: 行未至彭城，疽發背而死。
translations.literal: Journey not yet reaching Pengcheng, carbuncle erupted on back and died.
translations.idiomatic: Before reaching Pengcheng, Fan Zeng died when a carbuncle erupted on his back.

context.previous: 項王許之。

translations.chinese: 漢將紀信說漢王曰：「事已急矣，請為王誑楚為王，王可以閒出。」
translations.literal: Han general Ji Xin advised the Han king saying: 'The situation is already urgent, allow me to deceive Chu by posing as king, Your Majesty can secretly escape.'
translations.idiomatic: Han general Ji Xin advised the Han king: 'The situation is desperate. Let me impersonate you to deceive the Chu forces. You can slip away in secret.'

context.next: 於是漢王夜出女子滎陽東門被甲二千人，楚兵四面擊之。

translations.chinese: 於是漢王夜出女子滎陽東門被甲二千人，楚兵四面擊之。
translations.literal: Thereupon the Han king at night sent out women from Xingyang east gate wearing armor two thousand people, Chu troops attacked them from four sides.
translations.idiomatic: That night, the Han king sent two thousand women wearing armor out through Xingyang's east gate. The Chu troops attacked them from all sides.

context.previous: 漢將紀信說漢王曰：「事已急矣，請為王誑楚為王，王可以閒出。」
context.next: 紀信乘黃屋車，傅左纛，曰：「城中食盡，漢王降。」

translations.chinese: 紀信乘黃屋車，傅左纛，曰：「城中食盡，漢王降。」
translations.literal: Ji Xin rode the yellow-roofed carriage, attached left banner, said: 'City food exhausted, Han king surrenders.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Xin rode in the imperial yellow carriage with the left banner attached and announced: 'The city has run out of food. The King of Han surrenders.'

context.previous: 於是漢王夜出女子滎陽東門被甲二千人，楚兵四面擊之。
context.next: 楚軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.chinese: 楚軍皆呼萬歲。
translations.literal: Chu army all called out 'Ten thousand years.'
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army all shouted 'Long live the emperor!'

context.previous: 紀信乘黃屋車，傅左纛，曰：「城中食盡，漢王降。」
context.next: 漢王亦與數十騎從城西門出，走成皋。

translations.chinese: 漢王亦與數十騎從城西門出，走成皋。
translations.literal: Han king also with several ten horsemen from city west gate went out, fled to Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king also slipped out through the west gate with a few dozen horsemen and fled to Chenggao.

context.previous: 楚軍皆呼萬歲。
context.next: 項王見紀信，問：「漢王安在？」

translations.chinese: 項王見紀信，問：「漢王安在？」
translations.literal: King Xiang saw Ji Xin, asked: 'Where is the Han king?'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang saw Ji Xin and asked: 'Where is the King of Han?'

context.previous: 漢王亦與數十騎從城西門出，走成皋。
context.next: 曰：「漢王已出矣。」

translations.chinese: 曰：「漢王已出矣。」
translations.literal: Said: 'The Han king has already gone out.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The King of Han has already escaped.'

context.previous: 項王見紀信，問：「漢王安在？」
context.next: 項王燒殺紀信。

translations.chinese: 項王燒殺紀信。
translations.literal: King Xiang burned and killed Ji Xin.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang had Ji Xin burned alive.

context.previous: 曰：「漢王已出矣。」

translations.chinese: 漢王使御史大夫周苛、樅公、魏豹守滎陽。
translations.literal: Han king sent Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Marquis Cong, Wei Bao to defend Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king left Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Marquis Cong, and Wei Bao to defend Xingyang.

context.next: 周苛、樅公謀曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」

translations.chinese: 周苛、樅公謀曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」
translations.literal: Zhou Ke, Marquis Cong plotted saying: 'A king who has turned against his kingdom, difficult to defend the city with.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke and Marquis Cong conspired: 'A king who has betrayed his own kingdom is difficult to defend a city with.'

context.previous: 漢王使御史大夫周苛、樅公、魏豹守滎陽。
context.next: 乃共殺魏豹。

translations.chinese: 乃共殺魏豹。
translations.literal: Then together killed Wei Bao.
translations.idiomatic: They then killed Wei Bao together.

context.previous: 周苛、樅公謀曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」
context.next: 楚下滎陽城，生得周苛。

translations.chinese: 楚下滎陽城，生得周苛。
translations.literal: Chu conquered Xingyang city, captured Zhou Ke alive.
translations.idiomatic: Chu conquered Xingyang and captured Zhou Ke alive.

context.previous: 乃共殺魏豹。
context.next: 項王謂周苛曰：「為我將，我以公為上將軍，封三萬戶。」

translations.chinese: 項王謂周苛曰：「為我將，我以公為上將軍，封三萬戶。」
translations.literal: King Xiang told Zhou Ke: 'Serve as my general, I will make you Supreme General, enfeoff with thirty thousand households.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang told Zhou Ke: 'Serve as my general and I'll make you Supreme Commander, enfeoffing you with thirty thousand households.'

context.previous: 楚下滎陽城，生得周苛。
context.next: 周苛罵曰：「若不趣降漢，漢今虜若，若非漢敵也。」

translations.chinese: 周苛罵曰：「若不趣降漢，漢今虜若，若非漢敵也。」
translations.literal: Zhou Ke cursed saying: 'You do not quickly surrender to Han, Han now captures you alive, you are not Han's enemy.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke cursed: 'If you don't surrender to Han quickly, Han will capture you alive. You're no enemy of Han's.'

context.previous: 項王謂周苛曰：「為我將，我以公為上將軍，封三萬戶。」
context.next: 項王怒，烹周苛，井殺樅公。

translations.chinese: 項王怒，烹周苛，井殺樅公。
translations.literal: King Xiang angered, boiled Zhou Ke, threw Marquis Cong into a well and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang flew into a rage. He had Zhou Ke boiled alive and threw Marquis Cong down a well to his death.

context.previous: 周苛罵曰：「若不趣降漢，漢今虜若，若非漢敵也。」

translations.chinese: 漢王之出滎陽，南走宛、葉，得九江王布，行收兵，復入保成皋。
translations.literal: Han king's departure from Xingyang, south fled to Wan, Ye, obtained Jiujiang King Bu, along the way gathered troops, again entered and defended Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: After leaving Xingyang, the Han king fled south to Wan and Ye. He obtained the allegiance of Ying Bu, King of Jiujiang, gathered troops along the way, and re-entered Chenggao for defense.

context.next: 漢之四年，項王進兵圍成皋。

translations.chinese: 漢之四年，項王進兵圍成皋。
translations.literal: Han fourth year, King Xiang advanced troops to besiege Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Han, King Xiang advanced his troops and besieged Chenggao.

context.previous: 漢王之出滎陽，南走宛、葉，得九江王布，行收兵，復入保成皋。
context.next: 漢王逃，獨與滕公出成皋北門，渡河走修武，從張耳、韓信軍。

translations.chinese: 漢王逃，獨與滕公出成皋北門，渡河走修武，從張耳、韓信軍。
translations.literal: Han king fled, alone with Teng Gong went out Chenggao north gate, crossed river fled to Xiuwu, joined Zhang Er, Han Xin army.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king fled, going out Chenggao's north gate alone with Teng Gong. They crossed the Yellow River and fled to Xiuwu, where they joined Zhang Er and Han Xin's army.

context.previous: 漢之四年，項王進兵圍成皋。
context.next: 諸將稍稍得出成皋，從漢王。

translations.chinese: 諸將稍稍得出成皋，從漢王。
translations.literal: The various generals gradually were able to go out from Chenggao, followed the Han king.
translations.idiomatic: The various generals gradually managed to escape from Chenggao and joined the Han king.

context.previous: 漢王逃，獨與滕公出成皋北門，渡河走修武，從張耳、韓信軍。
context.next: 楚遂拔成皋，欲西。

translations.chinese: 楚遂拔成皋，欲西。
translations.literal: Chu then conquered Chenggao, wished to go west.
translations.idiomatic: Chu then conquered Chenggao and prepared to advance westward.

context.previous: 諸將稍稍得出成皋，從漢王。
context.next: 漢使兵距之鞏，令其不得西。

translations.chinese: 漢使兵距之鞏，令其不得西。
translations.literal: Han sent troops to resist them at Gong, caused them not to be able to go west.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent troops to block them at Gong county, preventing their westward advance.

context.previous: 楚遂拔成皋，欲西。

translations.chinese: 是時，彭越渡河擊楚東阿，殺楚將軍薛公。
translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue crossed the river to attack Chu at Dong'e, killed Chu general Xue Gong.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue crossed the river and attacked Chu forces at Dong'e, killing the Chu general Xue Gong.

context.next: 項王乃自東擊彭越。

translations.chinese: 項王乃自東擊彭越。
translations.literal: King Xiang then personally went east to attack Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then personally led troops east to attack Peng Yue.

context.previous: 是時，彭越渡河擊楚東阿，殺楚將軍薛公。
context.next: 漢王得淮陰侯兵，欲渡河南。

translations.chinese: 漢王得淮陰侯兵，欲渡河南。
translations.literal: Han king obtained Marquis of Huaiyin troops, wished to cross south of the river.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king obtained Han Xin's troops and wanted to cross south of the Yellow River.

context.previous: 項王乃自東擊彭越。
context.next: 鄭忠說漢王，乃止壁河內。

translations.chinese: 鄭忠說漢王，乃止壁河內。
translations.literal: Zheng Zhong advised the Han king, then stopped and fortified in Henan.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Zhong advised the Han king, who then stopped and established fortifications in Henan.

context.previous: 漢王得淮陰侯兵，欲渡河南。
context.next: 使劉賈將兵佐彭越，燒楚積聚。

translations.chinese: 使劉賈將兵佐彭越，燒楚積聚。
translations.literal: Sent Liu Jia to lead troops to assist Peng Yue, burn Chu grain stores.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Liu Jia with troops to assist Peng Yue and burn Chu's grain supplies.

context.previous: 鄭忠說漢王，乃止壁河內。
context.next: 項王東擊破之，走彭越。

translations.chinese: 項王東擊破之，走彭越。
translations.literal: King Xiang east attacked and defeated them, put Peng Yue to flight.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang attacked east and defeated them, forcing Peng Yue to flee.

context.previous: 使劉賈將兵佐彭越，燒楚積聚。
context.next: 漢王則引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。

translations.chinese: 漢王則引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。
translations.literal: Han king then led troops to cross the river, again took Chenggao, stationed army at Guangwu, approached Aocang to eat.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king then led his troops across the river, recaptured Chenggao, stationed his army at Guangwu, and drew supplies from the Aocang granary.

context.previous: 項王東擊破之，走彭越。
context.next: 項王已定東海來，西，與漢俱臨廣武而軍，相守數月。

translations.chinese: 項王已定東海來，西，與漢俱臨廣武而軍，相守數月。
translations.literal: King Xiang having pacified Donghai came west, together with Han both faced Guangwu and stationed armies, confronted each other for several months.
translations.idiomatic: After pacifying Donghai, King Xiang came west. He and Han both stationed their armies facing Guangwu and confronted each other for several months.

context.previous: 漢王則引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。

translations.chinese: 當此時，彭越數反梁地，絕楚糧食，項王患之。
translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue repeatedly rebelled in Liang territory, cut off Chu grain supplies, King Xiang worried about it.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue repeatedly rebelled in Liang territory and cut off Chu's grain supplies. King Xiang was greatly troubled by this.

context.next: 為高俎，置太公其上，告漢王曰：「今不急下，吾烹太公。」

translations.chinese: 為高俎，置太公其上，告漢王曰：「今不急下，吾烹太公。」
translations.literal: Made a high chopping block, placed Taigong on it, told Han king: 'Now if not quickly surrender, I will boil Taigong.'
translations.idiomatic: He built a high chopping block, placed Liu Bang's father Taigong on it, and sent word to the Han king: 'Surrender quickly or I'll boil your father alive.'

context.previous: 當此時，彭越數反梁地，絕楚糧食，項王患之。
context.next: 漢王曰：「吾與項羽俱北面受命懷王，曰『約為兄弟』，吾翁即若翁，必欲烹而翁，則幸分我一桮羹。」

translations.chinese: 漢王曰：「吾與項羽俱北面受命懷王，曰『約為兄弟』，吾翁即若翁，必欲烹而翁，則幸分我一桮羹。」
translations.literal: Han king said: 'I and Xiang Yu both faced north to receive commands from King Huai, said "agreed to be brothers", my father is your father, if must boil your father, then fortunately divide me one cup of broth.'
translations.idiomatic: The Han king replied: 'Xiang Yu and I both bowed to King Huai and swore brotherhood. My father is your father too. If you must boil him, please save me a cup of the soup.'

context.previous: 為高俎，置太公其上，告漢王曰：「今不急下，吾烹太公。」
context.next: 項王怒，欲殺之。

translations.chinese: 項王怒，欲殺之。
translations.literal: King Xiang angered, wished to kill him.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang flew into a rage and wanted to kill him.

context.previous: 漢王曰：「吾與項羽俱北面受命懷王，曰『約為兄弟』，吾翁即若翁，必欲烹而翁，則幸分我一桮羹。」
context.next: 項伯曰：「天下事未可知，且為天下者不顧家，雖殺之無益，只益禍耳。」

translations.chinese: 項伯曰：「天下事未可知，且為天下者不顧家，雖殺之無益，只益禍耳。」
translations.literal: Xiang Bo said: 'World affairs not yet knowable, moreover one who contends for the empire does not care about family, though kill him no benefit, only increases disaster.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo said: 'The outcome of the empire is still uncertain. Besides, those who contend for the world don't care about family. Killing him would do no good and only bring more disaster.'

context.previous: 項王怒，欲殺之。
context.next: 項王從之。

translations.chinese: 項王從之。
translations.literal: King Xiang followed it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang heeded his advice.

context.previous: 項伯曰：「天下事未可知，且為天下者不顧家，雖殺之無益，只益禍耳。」

translations.chinese: 楚漢久相持未決，丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉漕。
translations.literal: Chu Han long confronted without decision, able-bodied suffered military service, old weak exhausted transporting supplies.
translations.idiomatic: Chu and Han had been locked in stalemate for a long time without resolution. The able-bodied suffered from military service while the old and weak were exhausted from transporting supplies.

context.next: 項王謂漢王曰：「天下匈匈數歲者，徒以吾兩人耳，願與漢王挑戰決雌雄，毋徒苦天下之民父子為也。」

translations.chinese: 項王謂漢王曰：「天下匈匈數歲者，徒以吾兩人耳，願與漢王挑戰決雌雄，毋徒苦天下之民父子為也。」
translations.literal: King Xiang told Han king: 'The world in chaos several years, only because of us two people, wish to challenge Han king to decide male-female, do not vainly make the world's people fathers and sons suffer.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang told the Han king: 'The empire has been in chaos for years all because of the two of us. I wish to challenge you to single combat to determine the victor. Let's not make the people of the world suffer needlessly.'

context.previous: 楚漢久相持未決，丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉漕。
context.next: 漢王笑謝曰：「吾寧鬬智，不能鬬力。」

translations.chinese: 漢王笑謝曰：「吾寧鬬智，不能鬬力。」
translations.literal: Han king laughing declined: 'I rather fight wisdom, cannot fight strength.'
translations.idiomatic: The Han king laughed and declined: 'I'd rather compete with wits than with brute strength.'

context.previous: 項王謂漢王曰：「天下匈匈數歲者，徒以吾兩人耳，願與漢王挑戰決雌雄，毋徒苦天下之民父子為也。」
context.next: 項王令壯士出挑戰。

translations.chinese: 項王令壯士出挑戰。
translations.literal: King Xiang ordered brave warriors to go out and challenge.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang ordered his champions to come out and issue challenges.

context.previous: 漢王笑謝曰：「吾寧鬬智，不能鬬力。」
context.next: 漢有善騎射者樓煩，楚挑戰三合，樓煩輒射殺之。

translations.chinese: 漢有善騎射者樓煩，楚挑戰三合，樓煩輒射殺之。
translations.literal: Han had skilled horseman archer Lou Fan, Chu challenged three rounds, Lou Fan immediately shot and killed them.
translations.idiomatic: Han had a skilled archer named Lou Fan. When Chu issued three challenges, Lou Fan shot and killed each challenger.

context.previous: 項王令壯士出挑戰。
context.next: 項王大怒，乃自被甲持戟挑戰。

translations.chinese: 項王大怒，乃自被甲持戟挑戰。
translations.literal: King Xiang greatly angered, then personally donned armor grasped halberd challenged.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang was furious and personally donned armor, grasped his halberd, and issued a challenge.

context.previous: 漢有善騎射者樓煩，楚挑戰三合，樓煩輒射殺之。
context.next: 樓煩欲射之，項王瞋目叱之，樓煩目不敢視，手不敢發，遂走還入壁，不敢復出。

translations.chinese: 樓煩欲射之，項王瞋目叱之，樓煩目不敢視，手不敢發，遂走還入壁，不敢復出。
translations.literal: Lou Fan wished to shoot him, King Xiang glared eyes berated him, Lou Fan eyes dared not look, hand dared not release, then fled back entered fortifications, dared not come out again.
translations.idiomatic: Lou Fan wanted to shoot him, but King Xiang glared and bellowed at him. Lou Fan couldn't meet his eyes or release his arrow. He fled back into the fortifications and never dared come out again.

context.previous: 項王大怒，乃自被甲持戟挑戰。
context.next: 漢王使人閒問之，乃項王也。

translations.chinese: 漢王使人閒問之，乃項王也。
translations.literal: Han king sent people secretly inquire about it, it was King Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king sent scouts to investigate secretly, and they discovered it was King Xiang himself.

context.previous: 樓煩欲射之，項王瞋目叱之，樓煩目不敢視，手不敢發，遂走還入壁，不敢復出。
context.next: 漢王大驚。

translations.chinese: 漢王大驚。
translations.literal: Han king greatly astonished.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was greatly shocked.

context.previous: 漢王使人閒問之，乃項王也。
context.next: 於是項王乃即漢王相與臨廣武閒而語。

translations.chinese: 於是項王乃即漢王相與臨廣武閒而語。
translations.literal: Thereupon King Xiang then approached the Han king and together faced Guangwu gap and spoke.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then approached the Han king and they spoke face-to-face across the Guangwu gap.

context.previous: 漢王大驚。
context.next: 漢王數之，項王怒，欲一戰。

translations.chinese: 漢王數之，項王怒，欲一戰。
translations.literal: Han king enumerated them, King Xiang angered, wished one battle.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king listed his grievances. King Xiang was furious and wanted to fight a decisive battle.

context.previous: 於是項王乃即漢王相與臨廣武閒而語。
context.next: 漢王不聽，項王伏弩射中漢王。

translations.chinese: 漢王不聽，項王伏弩射中漢王。
translations.literal: Han king did not listen, King Xiang hid crossbow shot hit Han king.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king wouldn't listen. King Xiang hid himself and shot the Han king with a crossbow.

context.previous: 漢王數之，項王怒，欲一戰。
context.next: 漢王傷，走入成皋。

translations.chinese: 漢王傷，走入成皋。
translations.literal: Han king wounded, fled entered Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king was wounded and fled back into Chenggao.

context.previous: 漢王不聽，項王伏弩射中漢王。

translations.chinese: 項王聞淮陰侯已舉河北，破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，乃使龍且往擊之。
translations.literal: King Xiang heard Marquis of Huaiyin already raised north of Yellow River, defeated Qi, Zhao, moreover wished to attack Chu, then sent Long Ju to go attack him.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang heard that Han Xin had already raised troops north of the Yellow River, defeated Qi and Zhao, and was about to attack Chu. He sent Long Ju to fight him.

context.next: 淮陰侯與戰，騎將灌嬰擊之，大破楚軍，殺龍且。

translations.chinese: 淮陰侯與戰，騎將灌嬰擊之，大破楚軍，殺龍且。
translations.literal: Marquis of Huaiyin fought with him, cavalry general Guan Ying attacked them, greatly defeated Chu army, killed Long Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin fought him. His cavalry commander Guan Ying attacked, crushing the Chu army and killing Long Ju.

context.previous: 項王聞淮陰侯已舉河北，破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，乃使龍且往擊之。
context.next: 韓信因自立為齊王。

translations.chinese: 韓信因自立為齊王。
translations.literal: Han Xin thus self-established as King of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin then proclaimed himself King of Qi.

context.previous: 淮陰侯與戰，騎將灌嬰擊之，大破楚軍，殺龍且。
context.next: 項王聞龍且軍破，則恐，使盱臺人武涉往說淮陰侯。

translations.chinese: 項王聞龍且軍破，則恐，使盱臺人武涉往說淮陰侯。
translations.literal: King Xiang heard Long Ju army defeated, then feared, sent Xutai person Wu She to go persuade Marquis of Huaiyin.
translations.idiomatic: When King Xiang heard that Long Ju's army was defeated, he became fearful and sent Wu She of Xutai to persuade Han Xin.

context.previous: 韓信因自立為齊王。
context.next: 淮陰侯弗聽。

translations.chinese: 淮陰侯弗聽。
translations.literal: Marquis of Huaiyin did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin would not listen.

context.previous: 項王聞龍且軍破，則恐，使盱臺人武涉往說淮陰侯。
context.next: 是時，彭越復反，下梁地，絕楚糧。

translations.chinese: 是時，彭越復反，下梁地，絕楚糧。
translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue again rebelled, conquered Liang territory, cut off Chu grain.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue rebelled again, conquered Liang territory, and cut off Chu's supplies.

context.previous: 淮陰侯弗聽。
context.next: 項王乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎等曰：「謹守成皋，則漢欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，毋令得東而已。

translations.chinese: 項王乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎等曰：「謹守成皋，則漢欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，毋令得東而已。
translations.literal: King Xiang then told Marquis of Haichun Grand Marshal Cao Jiu and others: 'Carefully defend Chenggao, if Han wishes to challenge, carefully do not fight with them, do not allow them to go east.'
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang then told Cao Jiu, Grand Marshal and Marquis of Haichun, and the others: 'Defend Chenggao carefully. If Han wants to challenge you, don't fight them under any circumstances. Just don't let them advance eastward.'

context.previous: 是時，彭越復反，下梁地，絕楚糧。
context.next: 我十五日必誅彭越，定梁地，復從將軍。」

translations.chinese: 我十五日必誅彭越，定梁地，復從將軍。」
translations.literal: I within fifteen days must execute Peng Yue, pacify Liang territory, again follow the general.'
translations.idiomatic: Within fifteen days I will surely execute Peng Yue, pacify Liang territory, and rejoin you generals.'

context.previous: 項王乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎等曰：「謹守成皋，則漢欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，毋令得東而已。
context.next: 乃東，行擊陳留、外黃。

translations.chinese: 乃東，行擊陳留、外黃。
translations.literal: Then went east, along the way attacked Chenliu, Waihuang.
translations.idiomatic: He then marched east, attacking Chenliu and Waihuang along the way.

context.previous: 我十五日必誅彭越，定梁地，復從將軍。」

translations.chinese: 外黃不下。
translations.literal: Waihuang did not surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Waihuang refused to surrender.

context.next: 數日，已降，項王怒，悉令男子年十五已上詣城東，欲阬之。

translations.chinese: 數日，已降，項王怒，悉令男子年十五已上詣城東，欲阬之。
translations.literal: Several days, already surrendered, King Xiang angered, all commanded males age fifteen and above go to city east, wished to bury them alive.
translations.idiomatic: After several days, the city surrendered. But King Xiang was angry and ordered all males fifteen and older to assemble east of the city, intending to bury them alive.

context.previous: 外黃不下。
context.next: 外黃令舍人兒年十三，往說項王曰：「彭越彊劫外黃，外黃恐，故且降，待大王。

translations.chinese: 外黃令舍人兒年十三，往說項王曰：「彭越彊劫外黃，外黃恐，故且降，待大王。
translations.literal: Waihuang magistrate's attendant boy age thirteen, went to persuade King Xiang: 'Peng Yue forcibly coerced Waihuang, Waihuang feared, therefore temporarily surrendered, awaited Your Majesty.
translations.idiomatic: A thirteen-year-old attendant of the Waihuang magistrate went to persuade King Xiang: 'Peng Yue forcibly coerced Waihuang into submission. The people were afraid, so they surrendered temporarily while waiting for Your Majesty.'

context.previous: 數日，已降，項王怒，悉令男子年十五已上詣城東，欲阬之。
context.next: 大王至，又皆阬之，百姓豈有歸心？

translations.chinese: 大王至，又皆阬之，百姓豈有歸心？
translations.literal: Your Majesty arrives, moreover all bury them alive, the people how have heart to submit?
translations.idiomatic: Now that Your Majesty has arrived, if you bury them all alive, how will the people ever submit to you?

context.previous: 外黃令舍人兒年十三，往說項王曰：「彭越彊劫外黃，外黃恐，故且降，待大王。
context.next: 從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」

translations.chinese: 從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」
translations.literal: From this eastward, Liang territory more than ten cities all fear, none willing to surrender.'
translations.idiomatic: East of here, all the cities in Liang territory—more than ten of them—will be terrified and none will surrender.'

context.previous: 大王至，又皆阬之，百姓豈有歸心？
context.next: 項王然其言，乃赦外黃當阬者。

translations.chinese: 項王然其言，乃赦外黃當阬者。
translations.literal: King Xiang approved his words, then pardoned Waihuang those who should be buried alive.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang accepted his advice and pardoned the people of Waihuang who were slated for mass execution.

context.previous: 從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」
context.next: 東至睢陽，聞之皆爭下項王。

translations.chinese: 東至睢陽，聞之皆爭下項王。
translations.literal: East to Suiyang, heard of it all competed to surrender to King Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: Word spread east as far as Suiyang, and all the cities competed to surrender to King Xiang.

context.previous: 項王然其言，乃赦外黃當阬者。

translations.chinese: 漢果數挑楚軍戰，楚軍不出。
translations.literal: Han indeed repeatedly provoked Chu army to battle, Chu army did not come out.
translations.idiomatic: As expected, Han repeatedly challenged the Chu army to battle, but the Chu army refused to come out.

context.next: 使人辱之，五六日，大司馬怒，渡兵汜水。

translations.chinese: 使人辱之，五六日，大司馬怒，渡兵汜水。
translations.literal: Sent people to insult him, five six days, Grand Marshal angered, crossed troops over Si River.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent men to insult Cao Jiu. After five or six days of this, the Grand Marshal grew furious and crossed his troops over the Si River.

context.previous: 漢果數挑楚軍戰，楚軍不出。
context.next: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。

translations.chinese: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。
translations.literal: Soldiers half crossed, Han attacked them, greatly defeated Chu army, completely obtained Chu state treasures.
translations.idiomatic: When half the soldiers had crossed, Han attacked them, crushing the Chu army and seizing all of Chu's treasures.

context.previous: 使人辱之，五六日，大司馬怒，渡兵汜水。
context.next: 大司馬咎、長史翳、塞王欣皆自剄汜水上。

translations.chinese: 大司馬咎、長史翳、塞王欣皆自剄汜水上。
translations.literal: Grand Marshal Jiu, Senior Secretary E, Sai King Xin all self-slit throats on Si River.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Cao Jiu, Senior Secretary E, and King Xin of Sai all slit their own throats on the banks of the Si River.

context.previous: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。
context.next: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。

translations.chinese: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。
translations.literal: Grand Marshal Jiu, formerly Qi prison clerk, Senior Secretary Xin also formerly Queyang prison official, two people once had kindness to Xiang Liang, therefore King Xiang trusted them.
translations.idiomatic: Cao Jiu, the Grand Marshal, had formerly been a prison clerk in Qi. Han Xin, the Senior Secretary, had been a prison official in Queyang. Both men had once shown kindness to Xiang Liang, which is why King Xiang trusted them.

context.previous: 大司馬咎、長史翳、塞王欣皆自剄汜水上。
context.next: 當是時，項王在睢陽，聞海春侯軍敗，則引兵還。

translations.chinese: 當是時，項王在睢陽，聞海春侯軍敗，則引兵還。
translations.literal: At this time, King Xiang at Suiyang, heard Marquis of Haichun army defeated, then led troops back.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, King Xiang was at Suiyang. When he heard that the Marquis of Haichun's army was defeated, he led his troops back.

context.previous: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。
context.next: 漢軍方圍鐘離眛於滎陽東，項王至，漢軍畏楚，盡走險阻。

translations.chinese: 漢軍方圍鐘離眛於滎陽東，項王至，漢軍畏楚，盡走險阻。
translations.literal: Han army just besieging Zhongli Mo at Xingyang east, King Xiang arrived, Han army feared Chu, all fled to dangerous places.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army was in the midst of besieging Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang when King Xiang arrived. The Han army feared Chu and all fled to defensive positions.

context.previous: 當是時，項王在睢陽，聞海春侯軍敗，則引兵還。

translations.chinese: 是時，漢兵盛食多，項王兵罷食絕。
translations.literal: At this time, Han troops abundant food plentiful, King Xiang troops exhausted food depleted.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Han had abundant troops and plentiful supplies, while King Xiang's troops were exhausted and out of food.

context.next: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。

translations.chinese: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。
translations.literal: Han sent Lu Jia to persuade King Xiang, request Taigong, King Xiang did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent Lu Jia to negotiate with King Xiang and request the return of Liu Bang's father Taigong, but King Xiang refused.

context.previous: 是時，漢兵盛食多，項王兵罷食絕。
context.next: 漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。

translations.chinese: 漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。
translations.literal: Han king again sent Marquis Gong to go persuade King Xiang, King Xiang then with Han agreed, divide the empire in middle, cede Honggou west to Han, Honggou east to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king then sent Marquis Gong to negotiate with King Xiang. King Xiang agreed to divide the empire with Han, ceding all territory west of the Honggou Canal to Han and keeping everything east for Chu.

context.previous: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。
context.next: 項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。

translations.chinese: 項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。
translations.literal: King Xiang permitted it, immediately returned Han king parents wives children.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang agreed and immediately returned the Han king's parents, wives, and children.

context.previous: 漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。
context.next: 軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.chinese: 軍皆呼萬歲。
translations.literal: Army all called out 'Ten thousand years.'
translations.idiomatic: The entire army shouted 'Long live the emperor!'

context.previous: 項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。
context.next: 漢王乃封侯公為平國君。

translations.chinese: 漢王乃封侯公為平國君。
translations.literal: Han king then enfeoffed Marquis Gong as Lord of Pingguo.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king then enfeoffed Marquis Gong as the Lord of Pingguo.

context.previous: 軍皆呼萬歲。
context.next: 匿弗肯復見。

translations.chinese: 匿弗肯復見。
translations.literal: Hid and refused to see again.
translations.idiomatic: He went into hiding and refused to see anyone again.

context.previous: 漢王乃封侯公為平國君。
context.next: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」

translations.chinese: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」
translations.literal: Said: 'This empire's eloquent persuader, wherever he resides overthrows kingdoms, therefore titled Lord of Pingguo.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'This man is the empire's most eloquent persuader. Wherever he resides, he can overthrow kingdoms. That's why he's called the Lord of Pingguo.'

context.previous: 匿弗肯復見。
context.next: 項王已約，乃引兵解而東歸。

translations.chinese: 項王已約，乃引兵解而東歸。
translations.literal: King Xiang having agreed, then led troops withdrew and east returned.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang had agreed to the treaty, so he led his troops in withdrawal and returned east.

context.previous: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」

translations.chinese: 漢欲西歸，張良、陳平說曰：「漢有天下太半，而諸侯皆附之。
translations.literal: Han wished to west return, Zhang Liang, Chen Ping advised: 'Han has more than half the empire, and all the feudal lords attach to it.
translations.idiomatic: Han was preparing to return west when Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised: 'Han now controls more than half the empire, and all the feudal lords are allied with us.'

context.next: 楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。

translations.chinese: 楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。
translations.literal: Chu troops exhausted food depleted, this heaven destroys Chu time, better take advantage of the opportunity and immediately seize it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu's troops are exhausted and out of food. This is heaven's moment to destroy Chu. We should seize this opportunity and conquer them now.'

context.previous: 漢欲西歸，張良、陳平說曰：「漢有天下太半，而諸侯皆附之。
context.next: 今釋弗擊，此所謂『養虎自遺患』也。」

translations.chinese: 今釋弗擊，此所謂『養虎自遺患』也。」
translations.literal: Now release without attacking, this called 'raise tiger self leave calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: If we let them go now without attacking, this is what they call 'raising a tiger that will bring disaster upon yourself.''

context.previous: 楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。
context.next: 漢王聽之。

translations.chinese: 漢王聽之。
translations.literal: Han king listened to it.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king heeded their advice.

context.previous: 今釋弗擊，此所謂『養虎自遺患』也。」
context.next: 漢五年，漢王乃追項王至陽夏南，止軍，與淮陰侯韓信、建成侯彭越期會而擊楚軍。

translations.chinese: 漢五年，漢王乃追項王至陽夏南，止軍，與淮陰侯韓信、建成侯彭越期會而擊楚軍。
translations.literal: Han fifth year, Han king then pursued King Xiang to Yangxia south, stopped army, with Marquis of Huaiyin Han Xin, Marquis of Jiancheng Peng Yue arranged meeting and attacked Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Han, the Han king pursued Xiang Yu south to Yangxia. He halted his army and arranged to meet with Han Xin, Marquis of Huaiyin, and Peng Yue, Marquis of Jiancheng, to attack the Chu army together.

context.previous: 漢王聽之。
context.next: 至固陵，而信、越之兵不會。

translations.chinese: 至固陵，而信、越之兵不會。
translations.literal: Arrived at Guling, but Xin, Yue troops did not meet.
translations.idiomatic: When they reached Guling, Han Xin and Peng Yue's troops failed to arrive for the rendezvous.

context.previous: 漢五年，漢王乃追項王至陽夏南，止軍，與淮陰侯韓信、建成侯彭越期會而擊楚軍。
context.next: 楚擊漢軍，大破之。

translations.chinese: 楚擊漢軍，大破之。
translations.literal: Chu attacked Han army, greatly defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu attacked the Han army and inflicted a major defeat.

context.previous: 至固陵，而信、越之兵不會。
context.next: 漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。

translations.chinese: 漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。
translations.literal: Han king again entered fortifications, deepened moats and defended himself.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king retreated back into his fortifications, deepened the moats, and defended himself.

context.previous: 楚擊漢軍，大破之。
context.next: 謂張子房曰：「諸侯不從約，為之柰何？」

translations.chinese: 謂張子房曰：「諸侯不從約，為之柰何？」
translations.literal: Told Zhang Zifang: 'The feudal lords do not follow the agreement, what to do about it?'
translations.idiomatic: He asked Zhang Liang: 'The feudal lords aren't honoring their agreements. What should we do?'

context.previous: 漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。
context.next: 對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。

translations.chinese: 對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。
translations.literal: Replied: 'Chu troops about to be defeated, Xin, Yue not yet have divided land, their not coming is naturally appropriate.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang replied: 'Chu's army is about to be defeated. Han Xin and Peng Yue haven't received their territorial divisions yet. It's only natural they wouldn't come.'
